greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Ordered factorizations of n with 3 parts.
reference: Arnold Knopfmacher and Michael Mays, Ordered and Unordered Factorizations of Integers, The Mathematica Journal, Vol 10 (1).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ n*(log(n)^2/2 + (3*gamma - 4)*log(n) + 3*gamma^2 - 9*gamma - 3*sg1 + 7), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620 and sg1 is the first Stieltjes constant (see A082633). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 07 2020
mathematica: OrderedFactorizations[1] = {{}}; OrderedFactorizations[n_?PrimeQ] := {{n}}; OrderedFactorizations[n_] := OrderedFactorizations[n] = Flatten[Function[d, Prepend[#, d] & /@ OrderedFactorizations[n/d]] /@ Rest[Divisors[n]], 1]; a[n_] := With[{of3 = Sort /@ Select[OrderedFactorizations[n], Length[#] == 3 &] // Union}, Length[Permutations /@ of3 // Flatten[#, 1] &]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 84}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 02 2013, copied and adapted from The Mathematica Journal *)
nn = 200; f[list_, i_] := list[[i]]; a = Prepend[Table[1, {nn}], 0];
c = Table[DirichletConvolve[f[a, n], f[a, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}];
Table[DirichletConvolve[f[a, n], f[c, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 06 2020 *)
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Nov 14 2011
